statement.tex: \\ \textbf{Check Point #1:}\text{ Can this integral } \\ \text{even be evaluated?}
\\ \text{If }\dfrac{1}{x^2-1} = \dfrac{A}{x-1} + \dfrac{B}{x+1}, \\ \text{then what are the values of A and B?}

options.tex: \text{Yes. }\dfrac{1}{x^2-1}\text{ is defined and continuous}\\ \text{for all (but not just) }x\gt 1\text{ and therefore}\\ \text{also for }x\in [2,3].\\ \text{Hence, the integral can be evaluated.}
\text{No. }\dfrac{1}{x^2-1}\text{ is discontinuous at }x = \pm 1.\\ \text{Hence, this integral cannot be evaluated.}

reason.tex: \int_a^b f(x)\cdot dx \text{ makes sense only if f(x) is} \\ \text{defined and continuous in }[a,b].\\ \text{For example, }\int_0^2\dfrac{dx}{x^2-1}\text{ is not defined as}\\ \dfrac{1}{x^2-1}\text{ is discontinuous at } x=1\in [0,2].
